title: What Problems Can Syphilis Cause?
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted disease ( STD ). It’s easily treated with antibiotics . If you have syphilis and don’t get treated, the infection can lead to a number of serious -- even life-threatening -- conditions. They develop over many years and may include:

content_blocks.text: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted disease ( STD ). It’s easily treated with antibiotics . If you have syphilis and don’t get treated, the infection can lead to a number of serious -- even life-threatening -- conditions. They develop over many years and may include:

sections.heading: Pregnancy Complications
content: If you have syphilis and are pregnant , you can pass it on to your unborn child. You might also have a higher risk of miscarriage, stillbirth (your baby being born dead), or your newborn dying within a few days.

Untreated babies who are born with syphilis can also have problems with their bones, blood , liver , spleen , brain , and skin . It may also cause blindness, seizures , developmental delays , and deafness .

content_blocks.text: If you have syphilis and are pregnant , you can pass it on to your unborn child. You might also have a higher risk of miscarriage, stillbirth (your baby being born dead), or your newborn dying within a few days.

Untreated babies who are born with syphilis can also have problems with their bones, blood , liver , spleen , brain , and skin . It may also cause blindness, seizures , developmental delays , and deafness .

sections.heading: Increased HIV risk
content: If you have syphilis, you’re up to 5 times more likely to get HIV . That’s because syphilis sores can be open, making it easy for HIV to get into your body while you’re having sex .

content_blocks.text: If you have syphilis, you’re up to 5 times more likely to get HIV . That’s because syphilis sores can be open, making it easy for HIV to get into your body while you’re having sex .

sections.heading: Gummas
content: These are small bumps of dead tissue and fiber. They can form throughout your body if you don’t get treated. You can get them in your internal organs and on bones or skin in the late stages. They typically go away with treatment.

content_blocks.text: These are small bumps of dead tissue and fiber. They can form throughout your body if you don’t get treated. You can get them in your internal organs and on bones or skin in the late stages. They typically go away with treatment.

sections.heading: Neurological Problems
content: If it’s not treated, syphilis can cause problems with your nervous system . Symptoms include:
bullets: Paralysis or inability to move part of your body

content_blocks.text: If it’s not treated, syphilis can cause problems with your nervous system . Symptoms include:
associated_bullets: Paralysis or inability to move part of your body

meta_description: Syphilis is easily treated with antibiotics. If you have this STD and don’t get treated, it can lead to a number of serious -- even life-threatening -- conditions. Learn more from WebMD.
